trigger_event: After the disputed referendum results and fresh evidence of ballot tampering, Oksana discovered a trove of data revealing how BCI scores had been manipulated to rig votes and punish dissent, implicating both officials and ordinary citizens.
dilemma: Oksana must decide whether to publicly share this explosive evidence, knowing it could fuel local justice and chaos, or keep it hidden and inform the Directorate, allowing them to suppress the fallout with emergency powers.
reason: Oksana is torn: her analytic instincts and recent late-night talks with Alex highlight both the healing that truth could bring and the risks of fueling retribution in an angry, divided city. She knows each option will reshape Stenograd’s future—and put her own safety in question.
choice_a: Share the evidence with neighborhood leaders, sparking grassroots justice but risking a wave of unpredictable confrontations.
belief_a: Only open reckoning with past wrongs can build genuine trust.
Hiding the truth perpetuates fear and cycles of abuse.
Communities must be empowered to resolve their own grievances, not controlled from above.
choice_b: Conceal the evidence and alert the Directorate, helping them trigger a harsh citywide crackdown that sidelines local voices for the promise of order.
belief_b: Revealing everything now will ignite revenge and leave the city ungovernable.
In times of crisis, order and authority must take priority over transparency.
Only central control can prevent vigilante justice from spiraling out of control.
